meanings.definition: (adjective) Resembling a small hill or mound.
meanings.sent1: The tumpy garden had tiny hills of flowers.
meanings.sent2: The children played on the tumpy hill in the park.
meanings.sent3: The tumpy cake looked like a delicious little mountain.
meanings.sent4: The tumpy clouds in the sky were fluffy and inviting.
meanings.sent5: The tumpy terrain made the hike challenging but fun.

meanings.sent1: She sat on the tumpy and watched the sunset.
meanings.sent2: The dog ran up the tumpy to chase a squirrel.
meanings.sent3: The ants worked hard to climb the tumpy in the garden.
meanings.sent4: The tumpy of sand at the beach was perfect for sunbathing.
meanings.sent5: The tumpy provided a great view of the surrounding landscape.

meanings.definition: (verb) To create or form into a small hill or mound.
meanings.sent1: They tumpy the soil to plant the seeds.
meanings.sent2: The gardener will tumpy the garden for better drainage.
meanings.sent3: He likes to tumpy the sand at the beach for sandcastles.
meanings.sent4: The artist will tumpy the clay to create a sculpture.
meanings.sent5: She tumpy the snow into a small hill for sledding.
